alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Gulf, southwestern Liberty and western Franklin Counties through 230 PM EDT/130 PM CDT/... At 144 PM EDT/1244 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Wewahitchka to 9 miles northwest of Apalachicola to 12 miles west of St George Island. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... St George Island, Eastpoint, Apalachicola, Franklin, Buck Siding, High Bluff, Tilton, Beverly, Green Point, Owens Bridge, Bay City, Sumatra, Howard Creek, Willis Landing, Apalachicola Airport, Creels, Hays Place, Dalkeith and Fort Gadsden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Liberty
